## Installation

You can install the development version of statnn from [GitHub](https://github.com/) with:

``` r
# install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("andrew-mcinerney/statnn")
```

## statnn()

The primary function in this package is `statnn()`.
It creates a more statistically-based object of an existing neural network
object.
Currently supports neural networks from `nnet`, `neuralnet`, `keras`, `ANN`,
and `torch`.

```{r, eval = FALSE}
library(statnn)
stnn <- statnn(object)
```

A useful summary table can be generated using
```{r, eval = FALSE}
summary(stnn)
```

and covariate-effect plots can be created using
```{r, eval = FALSE}
plot(stnn, conf_int = TRUE)
```

More information about these functions and their arguments can be found in the
documentation.
